data.title: John G. Doyle
data.meta_description: John Doyle is an associate in the firm’s Litigation & Arbitration Practice Group. John is a former federal prosecutor in the United States Army and a
data.text:
John Doyle is an associate in the firm’s Litigation & Arbitration Practice Group. John is a former federal prosecutor in the United States Army and a seasoned trial lawyer with extensive experience in federal civil litigation, criminal litigation, and regulatory investigations. With more than 16 years of experience, John has provided strategic advice and legal counsel to the Department of Defense’s most senior leaders. He successfully led teams domestically and abroad, concerning a wide array of legal competencies ranging from the defense of complex, multimillion‐dollar class action lawsuits, to carrying out anti‐terrorism and humanitarian assistance operations overseas.

Prior to joining Brown Rudnick, John was a senior litigation attorney and branch chief at the Department of the Army’s Litigation Division. John was responsible for defending the U.S. Army and its senior leaders in high-stakes litigation in federal district and appellate courts throughout the United States.

John is a decorated combat veteran with extensive operational expertise at the tactical and strategic levels. John maintains a Top Secret/Sensitive Compartmented Information security clearance.

Notice

You understand and agree that transmitting information to Brown Rudnick by e-mail does not establish an attorney-client relationship. By clicking the "Agree" link below, you acknowledge that (i) Brown Rudnick has no obligation to maintain the confidentiality of any information you submit to Brown Rudnick unless Brown Rudnick already represents you or Brown Rudnick later agrees to represent you; thus, if you are not a client, information you submit to Brown Rudnick by e-mail may be disclosed to others and (ii) you have read and understand the Brown Rudnick Terms of Use and Privacy Policy and that you agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of such Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.

If you would like to discuss becoming a client, please contact one of Brown Rudnick's attorneys to arrange for a meeting or telephone conference. Thank you for your interest in Brown Rudnick.
